WorkItem.Description:
I'm trying to use the formula parser only, and had a problem with this formula :
  MIN('sheet 1'!C39,'sheet 2'!C50)
As the regex is greedy, the cell reference expands from the first quote to the last one, and the resulting stack is looking like this :
    [0] => 'sheet 1'!C39,'sheet 2'!C50
    [1] => 1
    [2] => MIN(
Â 
The regex should be like this (replace \'.*\' with \'[^\']*\') :
Calculation.php[69]
const CALCULATION_REGEXP_CELLREF  = '(((\w*)|(\'[^\']*\')|(\"[^\"]*\"))!)?\$?([a-z]+)\$?(\d+)(:\$?([a-z]+)\$?(\d+))?';
WorkItem.Summary: Wrong RegEx for parsing cell references in formulas

Comments.Message: Will take a look. Thanks for pointing this out
Modified the regexp as suggested, and trimmed quotes from around the cellreference sheet name before calling extractCellRange()
